cs63

Class MousableActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • cs63.MousableActor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Card

    public abstract class MousableActor
extends Actor
    An actor that can be clicked on or dragged. This encapsulates the messy business of detecting mouse actions and moving the object, leaving subclasses to try to logically handle the action.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Whether this mousable actor is enabled.

    • Field Detail

      • enabled

        protected boolean enabled
        Whether this mousable actor is enabled. Unless it is enabled, the mouse will not act on it.

      • disable

        protected void disable()
        Disables clicks and drags on this card.

      • act

        public final void act()
        Handles clicks and drags of this mousable actor. At the end of a click or drag, this calls handleClick() or handleDrag(), respectively.
        Overrides:
        act in class Actor

      • handleClick

        public abstract boolean handleClick()

        Tries to handle a click on this mousable actor. A mouse action is considered to be a click if the movement is small enough that the actor's end location overlaps its start location.

        It may not always be possible to handle a click; for example, the user might have clicked on a Card that cannot be removed, in which case the method should return false, so the caller knows to move the object back to its original location.

        Returns:
        true if able to handle the click, false if not

      • handleDrag

        public abstract boolean handleDrag()

        Tries to handle a drag of this mousable actor. A mouse action is considered to be a drag if the movement is large enough that the actor's end location does not overlap its start location.

        It may not always be possible to handle a drag; for example, the user might have dragged a Card to an illegal location, such as onto a non-empty pile, in which case the method should return false, so the caller knows to move the object back to its original location.

        Returns:
        true if able to handle the drag, false if not
